summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and a Division Chief from the Office of the State Attorney for the 15th Judicial Circuit. The federal prosecutor is requesting files from the state's prior Epstein investigation to assist in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell, noting the absence of grand jury transcripts and signed search warrant affidavits.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the main email, requesting files related to the Jeffrey Epstein case from a state prosecutor's office to assist in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Division Chief
persons.context: The recipient of the request, identified as the Division Chief of the Special Victims Unit in the Office of the State Attorney for the 15th Judicial Circuit, who had previously discussed the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the prior state investigation and prosecution whose files are being requested by the federal prosecutor.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the federal prosecutor's related prosecution, for which the Epstein files are being sought.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Correspondence between a federal prosecutor and a state prosecutor regarding the sharing of investigative files.
The federal prosecutor's office is prosecuting Maxwell and seeks files from the state's prior investigation of Epstein, indicating their cases are related.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The federal prosecutor is working on the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The state prosecutor's office had a prior investigation and prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: File Request for Maxwell Prosecution
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails a state prosecutor to request files from the state's prior Epstein investigation to assist in the federal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Initial Discussion of File Request
events.description: Email correspondence indicates a discussion about providing discovery files, including police reports and statements, from the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
Office of the State Attorney for the 15th Judicial Circuit
keyFacts: A federal prosecutor from the SDNY is seeking files from a Florida state prosecutor's prior Epstein investigation to aid in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The requested files are notably missing grand jury transcripts and signed copies of the affidavit and warrant to search Epstein's residence.
The correspondence reveals coordination between federal and state prosecutors regarding evidence sharing for the Maxwell case.
The email includes a disclaimer about Florida's broad public records law, indicating the communication may be subject to public disclosure.
